quiz1.questionText: RAM stands for Random Access Memory
Java is an Object Oriented programming language
What the programming languages used for cpp files? (make sure to Capitalize)
quiz1.explanation: cpp is an acronym for C Plus PLus

quiz1.questionText: Which of these is the HTML tag for making text bold?
quiz1.explanation: <bold> is not an html tag, and the other tags have different purposes, so it must be <b>

quiz1.questionText: What does CPU stand for? (make sure the capitalize)
quiz1.explanation: CPU is an acronym for Central Processing Unit as it processes most data in the computer

quiz1.questionText: What Operating System is developed and maintained by Microsoft?
quiz1.explanation: Windows is owned by microsoft, while the others are owned by Apple, Linus Torvalds, and Google respectively

quiz1.questionText: Which is not a Java data type?
quiz1.explanation:
Floats and doubles store decimal
values, but decimal itself is not a data type; String and int
are also both valid data types.

quiz1.questionText:
_______________ is credited with
being the very first computer programmer. (Full name,
please)
quiz1.explanation:
Mathematician & writer Ada Lovelace
(1815-1852) wrote the world's first algorithm to the
Analytical Machine. The very first computer programmer
was a woman!

quiz1.questionText:
Which OS is developed & used by
Apple Inc.?
quiz1.explanation:
macOS is Apple's operating system for
personal computers & workstations; iOS is a system for
mobile devices.

quiz1.questionText:
Which of the following are object-
oriented languages?
quiz1.explanation:
C is an imperative procedural
language; it does not use classes, inheritance,
polymorphism, or other features of OOP.

quiz1.questionText:
GIF stands for ________
Interchange Format. (Please capitalize)
quiz1.explanation:
GIF stands for Graphics Interchange
Format.

GUI stands for Graphical User
Interface.

quiz1.questionText:
A binary system uses powers of
_____.
quiz1.explanation:
As indicated by the prefix bi-, binary
systems use powers of 2.

quiz1.questionText:
Which of the following are
functions of an operating system?
quiz1.explanation:
Database management is the
responsibility of a DBMS, not an operating system.
Operating systems do handle I/O management, job
scheduling & memory management.

quiz1.questionText:
Which of the following is the
ascending order of data hierarchy?
quiz1.explanation:
Bits make up bytes, which make fields,
which compose records, which together create files,
which ultimately form databases.

SQL stands for Standard Query
Language

A virus is a typically destructive
PROGRAM that replicates itself by modifying other
computer programs & inserting its own code.

quiz1.questionText:
Which of the following operations
are performed on RAM?
quiz1.explanation:
Both read & write operations can be
performed on RAM.

quiz1.questionText:
Python requires the use of ;'s at
the end of lines of code.
quiz1.explanation:
Unlike a language like Java, Python
DOES NOT require the use of ;'s to end lines of code.

quiz1.questionText:
Hash maps/hash tables store key-
value pairs.
quiz1.explanation:
Data IS inserted into hash maps using
key-value pairs.
